com.github.bwsoft.iris.message.sbe

Class SBEMessage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bwsoft.iris.message.sbe.SBEField
      • com.github.bwsoft.iris.message.sbe.SBEMessage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Field, Group, Message, java.io.Serializable

    public class SBEMessage
extends SBEField
implements Message
    The representation of a SBE message. It contains the definition of a SBE message. Use MessageUtil.toJsonString(com.github.bwsoft.iris.message.Group) to obtain the Json representation of the message definition. It provides wrap calls to wrap the existing SBE message buffer for read and modification. It provides create calls to create a SBE message. Typically do not make direct calls to wraps or creates in this class. Use the corresponding calls in the SBEMessageSchema instead.
    Author:
    yzhou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • wrapSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject wrapSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                 int offset)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Wrap a buffer with SBE message and return a GroupObject to get or modify the values of fields in the message. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.wrapSbeBuffer(ByteBuffer, int) to wrap a buffer containing an unknown message.
        Specified by:
        wrapSbeBuffer in interface Message
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer containing the SBE message
        offset - the starting position of the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject or null if this buffer does not contain the current SBEMessage

      • createSbeBuffer

        public GroupObject createSbeBuffer(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer,
                                   int offset)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Create a SBE buffer using the provided buffer. It returns a GroupObject for setting the field values. Typically this is not directly called. Instead one should use a factory method such as SBEMessageSchema.createSbeBuffer(int, ByteBuffer, int) to wrap a buffer.
        Specified by:
        createSbeBuffer in interface Message
        Parameters:
        buffer - a buffer to hold the SBE message
        offset - the starting position to create the SBE message in the buffer
        Returns:
        a GroupObject to set fields in the message

      • addField

        public Field addField(short id,
                      FieldType type,
                      short arrayLength)
        Description copied from interface: Group
        The factory class to add a field to this group. It returns the added Field object for the application to further modify its attributes. id and name have to be unique among direct children of this group. The field is considered to be an array by default. If not, specify the arrayLength to be 1.
        Specified by:
        addField in interface Group
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the field
        type - the type of this field. See available types in FieldType.
        arrayLength - the array size of this field
        Returns:
        the newly created field
